content:
I received the master’s degree in 2019 from the Faculty of Sciences, University of Porto in Network and Information Systems Engineering. I am currently working toward a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science at FCUP. My thesis focus on “Automated Privacy-Preserving Strategies”.
My main research interests are dedicated to data privacy-preservation techniques, including the risk of identity disclosure and data utility through the efficiency and accuracy of machine learning. My experiments focus on the analysis of the effectiveness of such techniques in re-identification risk as well the consequent impact on predictive performance.
summary: I received the master’s degree in 2019 from the Faculty of Sciences, University of Porto in Network and Information Systems Engineering. I am currently working toward a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science at FCUP.
title: Tânia Carvalho

content:
Slides can be added in a few ways:
 Create slides using Wowchemy’s Slides feature and link using slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes.  Further event details, including page elements such as image galleries, can be added to the body of this page.
summary: An example talk using Wowchemy's Markdown slides feature.
title: Example Talk
